  • java.lang.Object

extends NativeObject

        public void dispose()
        Description copied from class: NativeObject
        Deallocates the memory given to the created object. Called automatically upon object destruction, but this may cause unexpected behavior: this should be called manually when the object is no longer needed.
        Specified by:

      • createViewport

        public void createViewport(double xmin,
                           double ymin,
                           double xmax,
                           double ymax,
                           int viewport)
        Create a new viewport from (xmin,ymin) to (xmax,ymax).
        Parameters:
        xmin - the minimum X coordinate for the viewport (0.0 lesser or equal to 1.0)
        ymin - the minimum Y coordinate for the viewport (0.0 lesser or equal 1.0)
        xmax - the maximum X coordinate for the viewport (0.0 lesser or equal 1.0)
        ymax - the maximum Y coordinate for the viewport (0.0 lesser or equal 1.0)
        viewport - the id of the new viewport

      • spin

        public void spin()
        Calls the interactor and runs an internal loop.

      • spinOnce

        public void spinOnce(int time,
                     boolean forceRedraw)
        Calls the interactor and runs an internal loop.
        Parameters:
        time - How long (in ms) should the visualization loop be allowed to run.
        forceRedraw - if false it might return without doing anything if the interactor's framerate does not require a redraw yet.

      • addPointCloud

        public abstract boolean addPointCloud(PointCloud<PointT> cloud,
                                      java.lang.String id,
                                      int viewport)
        Adds point cloud to viewport.
        Parameters:
        cloud - the input cloud.
        id - is the id of the cloud
        viewport - is the viewport the cloud should be added to
        Returns:
        true if the cloud has been succesfully added.

      • removePointCloud

        public boolean removePointCloud(java.lang.String id,
                                int viewport)

      • removeAllPointClouds

        public boolean removeAllPointClouds(int viewport)

      • addPointCloudNormals

        public abstract boolean addPointCloudNormals(PointCloud<PointT> cloud,
                                             NormalCloud normals,
                                             int level,
                                             float scale,
                                             java.lang.String id,
                                             int viewport)
        Add the estimated surface normals of a Point Cloud to screen.
        Parameters:
        cloud - the input point cloud dataset containing the XYZ data
        normals - the input point cloud dataset containing the normal data
        level - display only every level'th point (default: 100)
        scale - the normal arrow scale (default: 0.02m)
        id - the point cloud object id (default: cloud)
        viewport - the view port where the Point Cloud should be added (default: all)
        Returns:
        true if the cloud has been successfully added

      • addCoordinateSystem

        public void addCoordinateSystem(double scale,
                                int viewport)
        Adds 3D axes describing a coordinate system to screen at 0,0,0.
        Parameters:
        scale - the scale of the axes (default: 1)
        viewport - the view port where the 3D axes should be added (default: all)

      • addCoordinateSystem

        public void addCoordinateSystem(double scale,
                                java.lang.String id,
                                int viewport)
        Adds 3D axes describing a coordinate system to screen at 0,0,0.
        Parameters:
        scale - the scale of the axes (default: 1)
        id - the coordinate system id
        viewport - the view port where the 3D axes should be added (default: all)

      • removeCoordinateSystem

        public void removeCoordinateSystem(int viewport)
        Removes coordinate system from viewport.
        Parameters:
        viewport - the viewport to remove the coordinate system from.

                                   int viewport)
        Removes coordinate system from viewport.
        Parameters:
        id - is the id of the coordinate system
        viewport - the viewport to remove the coordinate system from.
